Brooklyn Collection
Bill Powers photograph collection BCMS.0073
398 Megabytes , 125 digital photographic images in jpeg format.
1970-2016 125 digital photographs of the Brooklyn Bridge. This collection is available digitally on our digital collections.
Biographical
Bill Powers is a photographer, writer, theater director and filmmaker. Raised in Park Slope, he is a graduate of Brooklyn Technical High School, and later attended Mexico City College and the Pratt Institute, where he studied painting.
Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Use
The photographer holds the copyright to the images in this collection. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Bill Powers, 2016.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Bill Powers photograph collection, BCMS_0073, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of 125 photographs of the Brooklyn Bridge. The photographs are both black-and-white and color, dating 1970-2016.
